text: Not to beat a dead horse on the M1 Macs..., but some folks in my field are having a minor <https://gist.github.com/Houstonwp/b905920baa48891117ce9523420c1ab2#gistcomment-3602910|benchmarking game>. I though I was being a little conservative running benchmarks on my new Macbook Air with Julia 1.6 running on Rosetta2 (ie non-native). I just ran them on my i9-9900k desktop. And the Macbook is 0-20% _faster_ than the desktop on these simple numerical benchmarks

elements.text: Not to beat a dead horse on the M1 Macs..., but some folks in my field are having a minor
benchmarking game

. I though I was being a little conservative running benchmarks on my new Macbook Air with Julia 1.6 running on Rosetta2 (ie non-native). I just ran them on my i9-9900k desktop. And the Macbook is 0-20%
faster
than the desktop on these simple numerical benchmarks

text: Are all they running on Rosetta? For the Julia code, does replacing `isnothing` with `=== nothing` give any improvement?

text: different computers... no one's run it all on one set of hardware for totally apples-to-apples comparisons. But the differences are often order of magnitude where hadware shouldn't materially affect the ranking

text:
I ran on my ryzen 5950x out of curiousity

```minimum time:     875.291 ns (0.00% GC)
  median time:      902.927 ns (0.00% GC)
  mean time:        954.514 ns (4.16% GC)
  maximum time:     23.960 μs (95.86% GC)
  --------------```

text: How did you manage to get a Ryzen 5950x <@U011V2YN59N>?  I’m very envious, my son and I are waiting to get a Ryzen and an nVidia RTX 3090 to build a computer for the both of us.

elements.text: How did you manage to get a Ryzen 5950x
?  I’m very envious, my son and I are waiting to get a Ryzen and an nVidia RTX 3090 to build a computer for the both of us.

text: I gave up and got a 5600x and a rtx3070 (which was itself a feat), and couldn't be happier. Silent, cool, reasonable power draw below 250w and insanely fast.

elements.text: I gave up and got a 5600x and a rtx3070 (which was itself a feat), and couldn't be happier. Silent, cool, reasonable power draw below 250w and insanely fast.
